p: Rosmarinus officinalis, L. originating from the Mediterranean region is an aromatic plant from the Lamiaceae family. The province of Murcia (Southeast Spain) is one of the major processors and importers of rosemary. In the United States and Europe, rosemary is a unique spice commercially available for use as an antioxidant [ 5]. Rosemary extracts have been used in the treatment of diseases, due to its hepatoprotective potential [ 6], therapeutic potential for Alzheimerâ€™s disease [ 7] and its antiangiogenic effect [ 8]. On the other hand, they have been used in food preservation, because they prevent oxidation and microbial contamination [ 9, 10, 11, 12, 13]. Therefore, rosemary extract could be useful for replacing or even decreasing synthetic antioxidants in foods. As preservatives, rosemary extracts offer several technological advantages and benefits to consumers.
